item.title: Bitcoin a Reliable Alternative in Latin America - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Bitcoin a Reliable Alternative in Latin America - Bitcoin News

Bitcoin Also read: Looting of the Fox: The Story of Sabotage at ShapeShift is a phenomenon that has introduced a better way to transact for citizens all around the world. Due to a tumultuous recession affecting Latin American economies, the region's residents are embracing the digital currency as local citizens and businesses try to curb economic woes.

item.title: Industry Report: Bitcoin Error Makes Miner Rich, DCG Grows Empire
item.description:
Industry Report: Bitcoin Error Makes Miner Rich, DCG Grows Empire

Want to catch up on digital currency news? This week, an accidental transaction landed a bitcoin miner a hefty sum of coins, and Barry Silbert's Digital Currency Group got even bigger. Take a look and see what you've been missing.

item.title: The Road To Bitcoin Adoption Passes Through Many Stages
item.description:
The Road To Bitcoin Adoption Passes Through Many Stages

Unfortunately, we have come at a crossroads in the Bitcoin world, as the focus seems to be shifting to blockchain. People view Bitcoin as a variety of tools, ranging from something that facilitates illegal activity to financial freedom and just an investment vehicle.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Weekly Analysis - BTC Looks to Trade Higher - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Weekly Analysis - BTC Looks to Trade Higher - NEWSBTC

Bitcoin price showed a lot of bullish signs this past week, and it looks like BTC/USD remains in an uptrend as long as it stays above $440. Bitcoin price showed a lot of bullish signs this past week, and it looks like BTC/USD remains in an uptrend as long as it stays above $440.

item.title: Things That Go Bump In The Night: IEX, Bitcoin, And The Smart Money
item.description:
Things That Go Bump In The Night: IEX, Bitcoin, And The Smart Money

The human animal prefers to live in an unchanged environment. Fear of change is an instinct in every species. For good reason. The salient factor about yesterday, in the world outside civilization where in earlier millennia human instinct was created, is that today's creatures survived it.

item.title: Ethereum and Bitcoin payment provider Plutus announces token crowd sale
item.description:
Ethereum and Bitcoin payment provider Plutus announces token crowd sale

Plutus, the mobile payments app that combines Bitcoin and Ethereum, is to hold a crowd sale of its Pluton tokens. The startup has also released a white paper and welcomed some executive talent to the team formerly of PayPal, Visa and Morgan Stanley.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Blunders, Suffers $15 Decline - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Blunders, Suffers $15 Decline - Bitcoinist.net

The bitcoin price has fallen... Probably not in the same manner as Olympus or London, but it has seemingly taken a trip down south to the $453 range at press time, equaling a $15 drop since our previous price study. Also read: Bitcoin Price Inches Towards $470, Will $500 be Next?

item.title: Bitcoin in India, Nigeria, Kenya to Spur Global ATM Market
item.description:
Bitcoin in India, Nigeria, Kenya to Spur Global ATM Market

The growing need for automated teller machines including Bitcoin ATMs in developing nations such as Nigeria, India, and Kenya is propelling the growth of the global ATM market, says Technavio's latest global ATM market report. The research highlights three key emerging trends predicted to impact market growth through 2020.

item.title: Bitcoin Will Succeed Despite Opposition Just Like Tesla Did
item.description:
Bitcoin Will Succeed Despite Opposition Just Like Tesla Did

There is no denying Bitcoin has a bright future ahead, although it will take some time until people get around to embracing this concept. For all of the opposition Bitcoin is facing these days; there is no reason for anyone to think cryptocurrency will go away anytime soon.

item.title: Bitcoin Gambling Approved in Isle of Man by Regulator
item.description:
Bitcoin Gambling Approved in Isle of Man by Regulator

The Isle of Man's Gambling Supervision Commission (GSC) and Treasury have approved changes to the island's gambling regulation that allow virtual currencies like Bitcoin to be accepted as cash, according to a report from the GSC's Mark Rutherford, deputy chief executive.
